creator.description:
A labeling service for the games industry. Managed by @trezy.codes.

Labels are applied manually and may be delayed.

locales.description: People directly involved in the development of a game, including programmers, designers, narrative, animators, writers, artists, composers, etc. This is available for any section of the industry, from AAA to indie to hobbyists.
locales.name: Game Dev

locales.description: Companies that contribute to the development of games. This includes consulting and outsourcing companies that may not build games from start to finish, but support other studios with getting their games across the finish line.
locales.name: Game Studio

locales.description: The diligent people that are preserving games history.
locales.name: Games Archivist

locales.description: Professors, instructors, and others involved in educating the games industry.
locales.name: Games Educator

locales.description: Individual journalists covering the games industry. If requesting this role, please include reference to your work.
locales.name: Games Journalist

locales.description: Events organizers that focus on the games industry. Event size is irrelevant, as we're interested in everything from local meetups to international conferences.
locales.name: Games Organizer

locales.description: Podcasts about games. NOT for individual podcasters.
locales.name: Games Podcast

locales.description: Physical and digital publications that cover games.
locales.name: Games Publication
